detail.content: Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer I: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Special Programs What Is Special Programs? Study Abroad Summer High School Summer in New York City Programs for Visiting Students Open Arts Minors Blog Events Newsletters Videos Admin & Faculty Alumni Contact Us  home > Special Programs        Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer I  REMU-UT.1501 Production 4 Credits Instructor(s): O'Reilly, M. Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer I familiarizes students with the practical aspects of the recording process in the studio by examining the theory, techniques, and science of sound recording. Students will be introduced to the basics of recording studios and sessions through lectures, demonstrations, supplemental reading and assignments carried out in the studio. In tandem with learning the mechanics of the process, students begin to develop their critical listening skills and audio vocabulary. Topics include: the propagation of sound and instrument radiation patterns, hearing and perception, microphones and microphone technique, analog signal flow, and signal processing. This course is not for Recorded Music majors. Note: There is a lab fee for this course. This course is also available for noncredit. Students interested in   taking this course as noncredit should register with course number   NCRD-UT 8501.001. Check   Albert for course schedule. Please visit the Bursar's website for tuition and course fee details. Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer II: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Recorded Music Program Courses Internships News & Events Facilities Alumni Faculty Directory Recorded Music FAQs For High School Students Facebook Twitter YouTube Summer In Recorded Music Academic Advisement Resources 194 Recordings  home > Recorded Music        Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer II  REMU-UT.1502 Production 4 Credits Instructor(s): Staff Note: There is a lab fee for this course. Pre-requisite for summer students: REMU-UT 1501 Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer I, or comparable knowledge. Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer II is a continuation of the Institute’s hands-on music recording course. Taught by veteran professional recording engineers through lectures, demonstrations, supplemental reading and assignments, students will be introduced to the “tools of the trade“ of the producer/engineer. Utilizing the Institute’s state-of-the-art SSL console-equipped recording studio, students will explore topics which include: compression, expansion/gating, time domain processes (delay, reverberation), vocal recording techniques, stereo microphone recording techniques, and mixing techniques. The course will culminate with the students recording and mixing an original song. This course is not for Recorded Music majors. Pre-requisite for summer students: REMU-UT 1501 Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer I, or comparable knowledge. Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer II is a continuation of the Institute’s hands-on music recording course. Taught by veteran professional recording engineers through lectures, demonstrations, supplemental reading and assignments, students will be introduced to the “tools of the trade“ of the producer/engineer. Utilizing the Institute’s state-of-the-art SSL console-equipped recording studio, students will explore topics which include: compression, expansion/gating, time domain processes (delay, reverberation), vocal recording techniques, stereo microphone recording techniques, and mixing techniques. Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer I: Tisch School of the Arts at NYU                           Skip to content        Recorded Music Program Courses Internships News & Events Facilities Alumni Faculty Directory Recorded Music FAQs For High School Students Facebook Twitter YouTube Summer In Recorded Music Academic Advisement Resources 194 Recordings  home > Recorded Music        Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer I  REMU-UT.1501 Production 4 Credits Instructor(s): Staff Note: There is a lab fee for this course. Studio Recording for the Modern Producer/Engineer I is a hands-on music recording course that familiarizes students with the practical aspects of the recording process. Taught by veteran professional recording engineers from today’s music industry, students will be introduced to the basics of recording through lectures, demonstrations, supplemental reading and assignments. Students will utilize the Institute’s state-of-the-art SSL console-equipped recording studio to explore topics which include: analog signal flow, the propagation of sound, hearing and audio perception, microphone types, usage and microphone placement techniques, equalization and signal processing. The course will culminate with the students recording and mixing an original song. This course is not for Recorded Music majors.
